alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Camden and northeastern Currituck Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Currituck, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Currituck around 510 PM EDT. Indiantown around 515 PM EDT. Corolla around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Barco, Coinjock, Riddle, Snowden, Aydlett, Waterlily, Gregory, Sligo, Bartlett and Taylors Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
